Reviews.Title: More features than I would have ever expected!
Reviews.Author: NM
Reviews.Content: "Don't judge a book by it's cover" was never more true in this case. I wanted a camera of higher quality than your typical web-cam, so while I was scrolling through the results of "wireless cam" I initially missed this one due to it's visual similarity to webcams. But then I saw how highly it was rated and decided to try it. After owning the cam for over a month, I could _not_ be more impressed! It has all the features I was looking for and then some. Most importantly, onboard continuous loop recording to a SD card (or to remote servers), uploading of images to a remote server when motion is detected, and password protected web access (both through [...] or through active streaming using a viewer such as VLC).The other reviews have covered most things that can be said, so I'll only try to fill in a few more blanks. The quality of the picture is excellent for the price. However, the moonlight mode does (understandably) drop the fps, yet unfortunately it still didn't quite have the sensitivity I had hoped for. There is a street light outside of my home, and although I can see fine with my eyes, the picture is completely dark even in moonlight mode. That's not too much of a problem though since the night-vision version is more appropriate for that use anyway.Here's a quick run-down of all the settings available, since I don't think they are documented very well in the detailed specs:Camera Setup: - Light frequency - Image rotation - Moonlight mode on/off - Power (activity) LED on/off - Show FPS - Mic on/offStream Setup: - Independent Primary/Secondary/Mobile stream image size/framerate/quality settingsOSD Setup: - On Screen Display (overlayed on video) configurationWireless Setup: - Infrastructure or AdHoc modes - WEP, WPA, and WPA2TCP/IP Setup: - DNS settings - Configurable ports - Basic or Digest Access AuthenticationPPoE Setup: - PPPoE dial-up on/offDDNS Setup: - Service, host name, username, passwordUPNP Setup - Universal PlugAndPlay Enable/disableAlarm Setup - Motion Detection (up to 4 configurable zones of sensitivity) - Schedule Setup (configurable alarm schedules) - Alarm Management (FTP/email/[...] of snapshots when the alarm is triggered) - Periodic Sending (FTP/email/[...] of customizable timed periodic snapshots)Alarm Server Setup (configure FTP/email/[...] servers)SD card Function Setup: - Record on alarm on/off - Snapshot on alarm on/off - Continuous record on/off (and this does truly loop, deleting oldest files to make room for new ones) - Snapshot at interval on/off - SD card FTP sending on/off - Browse SD card - Format SD cardTools: - System identity - User management (can add login users, turn anonymous access on/off) - Date & Time (configure time servers) - Backup or Restore settings - Firmware Upgrade (can only be done by support)System Tab: - Shows SD card status/space, wireless strength, active users, etc.Although it's true as others have mentioned that there's no phone number for customer service, only email, they are incredibly responsive, and they truly know the product. You can expect a rapid reply that truly addresses your issue and not just canned unintelligent replies. If you buy this cam, be sure to contact them immediately, as they will download new firmware to your camera that fixes bugs and adds new features. This should be done right off the bat since the firmware overwrites your settings.For the money, I don't think you can go wrong with this wireless camera!

Reviews.Title: Lots of features at an affordable price
Reviews.Author: C. Crocker
Reviews.Content: After researching and trying other options for monitoring my newborn daughter's nursery, I chose the 2606 because it offers a wide variety of features for an affordable price. Combining a wide angle lens, a low light setting (be sure you enable the "moonlight" setting to get maximum performance), and several simultaneous streaming options including some with two-way audio, the 2606 is a very versatile camera. Unlike some other wireless IP cameras, the 2606 offers several levels of encryption including WPA2-PSK which was a huge selling factor for me. Another HUGE selling factor for me was the cross platform compatibility since my primary system is a Fedora Linux machine. One thing to note on this point is that the included software is Windows only but it's only used for the initial setup of the camera (really it just scans your network to determine the IP address of the camera). However, all you really need to know after you plug the camera in is what IP address was assigned to it. Once you know the IP address, all settings can be set through a web browser regardless of platform.  After installing the included software, simply plug the camera into your router and run the software and your camera will be automatically detected (again if you know how to determine the camera's IP address then you don't even have to install the software).  The camera also has built-in motion detection and alarming capabilities so you can be notified via several options such as e-mail whenever motion is detected in view of the camera.  If you're looking for a great wireless camera and you don't need total darkness vision (if you do check out the 2607), then the 2606 is a really nice camera which offers plenty of technology for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: great multi-room nanny cam
Reviews.Author: B. wang "amazon mom"
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 sharx cameras to watch my new nanny. the set up is very easy, just read the enclosed user manual and follow the directions. within 15 mins i got the video image live on my home computer. the cameras are installed in living room, baby bed room and dining room. all 3 video can be seen in one control window. (i use the app called Multilive, which is included in the setup CD)i emailed the web addresses of the cameras to my friends, they tried it and everything worked well for them too.to watch the live video at my work though, is another story. my company has very good firewall, blocking pretty much every port. each of my cameras need an open port to work. port 80 is common for internet use, tried that first and it worked. if you experience the same difficulty watching the video from work, just try the following steps: in the camera setting screen, click network, then click UPNP. change the external HTTP/RTSP port range to 80 -- 80. for multiple cameras, you need to contact your IT department to see what other port numbers are available. try 8080 and 1755, they are common open ports.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value, quality, and accessibility
Reviews.Author: lh "-lh-"
Reviews.Content: I have to say, you really won't understand how great this camera is unless you try other ones.  First off - this camera is 640x480!  There's one I saw her called "DropCam" that seemed cool.  But it's a 320x240 resolution camera AND you may have to pay per month!  I looked through a lot of IP cameras before deciding on this one.  Even though I've not owned other IP cameras, you can tell this is the best one just by researching.  I've not needed support but they seem to be responsive.This camera puts out 680x480 resolution.  Amazing quality!  I love that I can access on my laptop remotely through a web address (for free) and through my Palm Pre, or any other mobile phone with a good data plan.  One small gripe is that I can't get anything higher than a 176x144 resolution for your phone, but it's no biggie.  You can still see a great picture/video.Setup was easy.  Plug your camera into your router via ethernet cable.  Enter the IP address (determined by router) and enter admin for user and admin for password and you're in.  Change whatever settings you need but make sure you connect to your wireless network under "wireless."  Let it search and enter the password and you're up and running.  (Follow instructions if any issues).  I got it up and running in 5 minutes.Even though it's an indoor camera I have it hanging outdoors under my roof to watch my driveway since we think people might be walking through to get to our backyard.Lastly, did I mention there's audio?!  Many other wireless IP cams don't even offer this.  You can adjust the volume remotely if you want to.  All settings are adjustable from wherever you are.  PLUS - all 2010 models now have a SD card option that will auto-record via motion detection and you can access controls/media remotely (i think you can delete content, etc all remotely so you don't need to pull out the card to do so).  Amazing.I'm really glad I got this camera.  It has great picture quality, many web features, and all at an amazing price.  I got it via Ebay through Secure Camera direct (although you can't tell it's them) and used Bing Cashback for 8%+ off depending on the special.  It's $229.xx minus cashback and then free shipping (no tax).  Awesome!****Update**** 02-24-2010I just had a support call because I wanted to see if I could get higher resolution on my Palm Pre.  They helped me to connect to another link where I was able to get 320 x 240 resolution on my phone.  It was so much clearer.  Love it.  They also said they would give me an outdoor version of this camera for the same price if I wanted it (it was just released) or if this camera ever  messed up b/c I have it outdoors, they'd replace it for me with the outdoor version.  Awesome!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: P. Pieri
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these at one of my customer. They have one checking pool area, one checking the property and 2 in their shop. They are clear as a bell. They have the software setup so they can see all 4 at one time on a separate monitor. The latest firmware make them easy to setup. All 4 are wireless going to a netgear router. They have 2 computers with extra monitors and they both can see all. Early on with the old software they were a little confusing to setup but with the latest firmware they are a snap. They stay connected 98% of time. Once in awhile they stop and usually a reset of software cures it.  The customer support is probably one of the best I have seen, I deal with support in my job and I wish other companies were as go as they are. I had a slight problem with one camera and I sent it back and they fix it and returned it with latest updates both hardware and software. I can't say enough about their support.  The cameras are clear and the sound on them are also good. You could use them at your house for door security. I am going to install one so I can see and talk to anyone at the door.  The price of the cameras are a little on the expensive side but you get what you pay for. If you want quality and clearity this is a good choice.  I setup up the cameras for viewing on the net. I use NO-IP which I use for my personal projects as well. You can get a free account or a pay one depending on what you want.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Lady
Reviews.Content: Had this unit for about 6 months.  Using it with an up-to-date imac and time capsule.  I have spent many, many hours trying to figure out why one minute a feature works fine and then the next minute it doesn't.  Tried all the options: record to SSD card (never got that to work consistently), upload via FTP (never worked), and email alerts (worked inconsistently and never useful).  I would definitely not recommend trying to use motion sensing looking out a window.  Too many false alarms due to leaves moving, snow, rain, dust, etc..  Couldn't adjust the threshold and sensitivity enough before it would be blind to me walking right in front of it.  Don't know if there are better systems.Update:  I had a lot of problems with the camera early on, mostly due to a bad SSD card, but now that I've had it for a couple of years, I've worked out the bugs and it works great (other than false alarms if you point it outside).  The ability to send video footage to a remote server or monitor remotely is great.  Customer service has also improved a lot.

Reviews.Title: Very good wireless webcam
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Romero
Reviews.Content: After hours and hours of research, I purchased the Sharx Security VIPcella SCNC2606 about 3 months ago. I use it to "tune in" to see my 3 month old in her crib while I'm at work. As has been described here by other reviewers, the camera can be a bit of a challenge to set up, but if you follow the detailed instructions carefully, most people should be able to set it up with little or no problem. It would have taken me about 30 minutes to do it if my wifi network name had been one word instead of 3. Overall, it took me about an hour or so (and I have very limited experience with setting up network stuff like printers and wifi routers). As many others have noted, Sharx's customer service is very responsive. I emailed them a question after I set it up and got a response quickly.The camera's resolution/video quality is excellent, even in relatively low light. I can use my iPhone/iPad to see my baby anywhere in the world! A few caveats: 1) While I can use the camera with my macs (and set it up via mac), I cannot control some of its functions like zoom. For that, you need to use a PC. 2) My company restricts streaming video so I'm forced to use a proxy site whenever I want to use it from work. 3) Be careful if you use your iPhone/smartphone often: streaming video can increase your data usage costs pretty rapidly.

Reviews.Title: Great quality and very easy setup
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to get security cameras for my house for years now.  Whether to catch the people who were throwing their dog's excrement on my porch, the guy stealing my UPS packages, to monitor my dog, or just to quickly check who's ringing my doorbell when I'm in another part of my house and may not want to talk to a solicitor.  There are so many times I have wished I had a camera and didn't. As such, I have done a lot of research over the last 6 months into different inexpensive home monitoring options, research that was thrown into overdrive when I had someone break into my bedroom window and help themselves to my TV and Kindle Fire.  Ultimately, I settled on several cameras from Sharx.CAMERA SELECTIONInitially I had a lot of confusion about which camera to get so I'll briefly list the different cameras and the main differences between them below:SCNC2606 Wifi Wireless Camera - This is an indoor wireless camera and probably the best option for most indoor applications.SCNC2607 Wifi Wireless Camera with Infrared Night Vision - Indoor wireless camera. This camera comes with infrared night vision, and is mainly designed to be used in low to dark environments.  It does not have as good daytime colors as the 2606.  It is not designed to be used outdoors, as it is not sealed, but if you use it in a covered environment like under a porch, and you do not have extremes in temperature and humidity, it might be acceptable as an outdoor camera. Be prepared for the possibility that using it outdoors will lead to rust and it may stop working though.SCNC2700 Wifi Wireless Camera with MicroSD DVR and True Day/Night vision - Indoor wireless camera with day and night vision.  If you need to be able to record in day and night, get this camera over the previous two.  The infrared filter cuts off during the day, so that it doesn't mute the colors, and then cuts on at night to allow video in total darkness.SCNC3606 Cat5 PoE Wired Weatherproof Outdoor Camera with Infrared Night Vision and built in DVR - This is an outdoor camera that requires a wired ethernet connection.  It is completely sealed so it will last directly in the elements.  It comes with PoE (power over ethernet) so it is useful in applications where you don't have close access to an outlet.  As of March 2012, it contains an updated lens that is sharper than the SCNC2606, SCNC2607 and SCNC2607WAdditionally, as of Fall 2011, the SCNC2700 and SCNC2700W contain an updated lens that is sharper.  The 3605 and 3606 received the updated lens in March 2012.  The SCNC2606, SCNC2607 and SCNC2607W will not receive the updated lens.INSTALLATION / CUSTOMER SUPPORTI would say I am an advanced computer user, and intermediate when it comes to working with routers. I thought setup was going to be difficult since I didn't really know what port forwarding, DHCP, or UPNP was, but it was incredibly easy. The instruction manual is extremely thorough and describes everything in detail.  This is one of the best and most comprehensive manuals I have received for a product.  They think of every question you could have.  Even if you have fairly basic tech skills, if you read the entire manual, you should have most of your questions answered.  I had the camera set up and recording in about 10 minutes, and had the complete installation done (including running the ethernet line) in an hour.  You can run it wirelessly, but I wanted faster transfer speeds through ethernet.  I really thought it was going to be a pain to have to deal with customer support through email but I couldn't have been happier.  They answered all my questions (which were numerous) within 24 hours and were willing to provide all the support I needed for my router.  They even notified me that one of the cameras I had ordered had been upgraded that weekend to a new 2012 model with a sharper lens, and allowed me to exchange my camera for the 2012 model, which they shipped out to me immediately (they covered shipping) without requiring that they receive my exchange first.  At a minimum, you are going to need to know the address to access your router's administration page (it will be a local numerical address, like 192.168.100.1), and the password to login to that page.  You can do a search on the Internet and easily find this information. Contact me through the comments page and I can help you if needed.  You will also need to know the login information for your wireless network.  I was initially going to purchase a much cheaper camera that I was told uses the exact same hardware as the Sharx, but I think the support you receive from this company is definitely worth the extra cost.  I do wish their web site had a forum where users could exchange information and get help from each other.SOFTWAREThe interface is very thorough if you use the advanced setup options, and gives you a lot of flexibility with the camera.  It comes with a CD, but the program on the CD is really just designed to determine the local IP address of the camera and isn't really needed if you can figure it out yourself (unless you are setting up more than one camera, in which case you'll want to use the Multi Camera software from the CD). Otherwise, everything is handled through your web browser with ActiveX.  I had to use Internet Explorer to get the full functionality for the camera, as some of the tools would not show up in Chrome and Firefox. I've added an image showing all the configuration options through the control panel.  There is a "system" page that displays all of the current information about your camera, including your local and wide area IP address, UPNP status, Internet connection status, MAC address, and many other variables. This screen is very useful for troubleshooting and setting up the camera.  Once you have your camera set up, you should turn on the On Screen Display so it captures the date and time on the video feed.  You can set up a Gmail account to have it email you images during alarms or just at specific intervals.You can even set up a dedicated Gmail account and have it send a picture to itself every 5 minutes indefinitely (or until you use up Gmail's storage space, at which point you can delete everything and start again).  There is a motion detector on the camera that works very well.  It allows you to set up to 4 different windows/areas for monitoring, all completely customizable with different settings. For instance, you can set up the entire viewable area to check for any motion, or you can set up a very time section of the screen to focus on the corner of your door, so it will only trigger an alarm when someone opens the door and it sees movement. For my indoor camera, I have a motion detector and alarm schedule set up so it will only be active while I'm at work.  It records all the time, but the motion sensor alarm cuts off during the hours I'm typically home so I don't set it off.  I wish you could set up different alarm schedules for each independent window for even more customization, but for right now, the software is pretty good as it is.DVR/MONITORINGThe main thing you will want, is a way to save your video feed to an external source.  If a criminal steals your camera (if you are saving to the SD card) or your desktop the video you saved to it of the crime won't do you much good when you don't have access to it.  Initially, I saved my video feed to an external hard drive that I mounted under my locked crawl space, and ran the cables to it through a small hole in my floor.  A knowledgeable thief could still delete the video file right from your desktop, but I think that's very unlikely.  To be extra safe, you could just password-protect your windows account so it locks after 15 minutes of inactivity.  Even better, I eventually just added a link to the camera on my office computer and set it to constantly record there.  Even if my house burns down, I'll have a copy of the video saved at a safe location.The Sharx instructions give you complete details for setting up the camera through your phone's web browser, but I found it to be a huge pain to do.  It is much easier to use a third party app.  The best Android app is TinyCam Monitor. This program works beautifully. The paid version gives you a few more options and allows you to record directly from the phone, but it's not necessary at all.HARDWAREThe SCNC2606 has an excellent build quality, although it's not quite as sturdy as their outdoor cameras since the housing is hard plastic rather than metal.  The bottom of the camera has a slot for a microSD card, giving you the option of recording directly to the card instead of a hard drive.  I have a 16GB card in my camera which will cover quite a bit of high quality video.UPDATESOne disadvantage with Sharx cameras is that you can only obtain firmware upgrades by contacting support, and having them install them remotely.  My camera came with the latest firmware installed, but I don't see how anyone would know when new firmware updates are released since I couldn't find anything about it on their web site.  Make sure you email them and get the latest firmware before you start setting everything up, because updating the firmware will reset everything.CONS- No Power over Ethernet (PoE), which would make this camera much easier to install.  I had to run the power adapter through the wall and into a bathroom, where it sticks out a bit.  Make sure that you have a socket available in the location you want the camera.- Form factor is boxy (about the size of two packs of cigarettes side by side), so it's a bit difficult to hide the camera if you don't want anyone to notice it.CONCLUSIONI am confident the intruder who broke into my house and walked around my house with one of my large knives will never be caught, which makes it all the more frustrating that I hadn't picked up a Sharx camera earlier. While they won't necessarily prevent a problem from happening (although no one is going to break into your house once they see that it's being monitored), I really think everyone should invest a few hundred dollars into video surveillance for their homes.

Reviews.Title: Great product but config is nightmare!
Reviews.Author: E. Valiente "tekJUNKIE"
Reviews.Content: The product itself is quite robust in the features that it offers.  It comes with PC software (to bad for us Mac users) and a manual, if you could call it that without laughing.  The physical installation was simple and the built-in server works very well.  Unfortunately, the configuration of the wireless can be a headache for the non-techie.  I consider myself and ubberteckie and I was baffled by the many times I had jump back and forth in the manual; from the beginning to the appendix... back and forth.  Whoever wrote that manual was basically spewing all their random thoughts on paper and never bothered to look back.  I hate to rate the product so low because of how well it functions.  But I felt I had to warn those using the wireless features connectivity.  The wireless transmitter is also very week.

Reviews.Title: Raving Fan
Reviews.Author: Thnrkly
Reviews.Content: Sharx makes a "pledge" that sounds too good to be true: "We pledge that we will not let you fail." This brave promise appears in various Sharx documents. I thought, "If anyone could put that to the test...I would be the perfect candidate." So I ordered a Sharx camera. Sure enough, my installation was challenging. Not Sharx fault. I had Comcast issues, Netgear issues, user error issues (self-inflicted), Vonage issues, and, every time...let me clarify...EVERY SINGLE TIME...Sharx answered my questions and got me through it.LET ME CLARIFY...Comcast was inept, Netgear ignored me, Vonage was a little bewildered but wanted to help, BUT SHARX DELIVERED. At one point, on Sunday night, after 9:00 pm, Sharx was emailing prompt answers to my questions, bending over backwards to get me through the jungle. LET ME CLARIFY: My situation was unique. My system had issues before I ordered the camera. 99% of you will have an easier time setting this up. Directions are super clear (underscoring the fact that Home Depot, fan installation instructions are, in fact, written by kindergarteners - No offense intended kids. For where you're at, these fan instructions are great!).99% of you wont have the tangled jungle I had to deal with, but I'll tell you this: if Sharx can come through for someone like me, they can deliver for ANYONE. So buy this product. buy 10, then get some for your friends. Support this company, send them flowers, and birthday cards, and let them know you care...because they rock. They absolutely rock.

Reviews.Title: Own three.  It's generally great, but...
Reviews.Author: qo
Reviews.Content: In the interest of brevity, I'll not rehash the pros of this camera(see the other 4 and 5 star reviews with which I generally agree).  It's a stable camera that gets the job done for the most part.  I own three, and plan to buy the outdoor version as well.Rather, I'll point out one con for those running Mac OS Lion server.  I tried to get this cam to record over SMB (that's the only option other than SD card) to a Mac Mini running Lion server.  This appears to be impossible due to the following (from the Mini's System log):'Jun 30 17:20:29 mini smbd[3450]: 10.x.x.x SMB client not supported - Unicode, NT Errors, Long Names and Extended Security are requiredBasically, the cam doesn't support SMB to the level that Lion requires.My plan was to have the cam save video and snapshots to a Dropbox folder so that they would be synced to my macs offsite.So, for now, the options appear to be:1. Enable FTP server on the Mini and save to a dropbox folder (but this seems only to support image upload).  This is working great.  To enable it, open Terminal.app and:a. Edit /System/Library/LaunchDaemons/ftp.plist and change Disabled to Enabled.b. sudo launchctl load /System/Library/LaunchDaemons/ftp.plist2. Use Evocam (which I've used for years) to save recordings to the Dropbox folder.  But the latest Evocam (4.11) crashes when setting up three networked cams.  I'm experimenting with distributing the cams across a couple macs...3. Buy an SD card and use the "FTP Sending" option to upload videos from the card to an FTP server (setup similarly to option 1).For now, I'm forced to use option 3 along with option 1.  Not the end of the world, but something folks should be aware of.ETA: Adding after further research...After some digging, it appears Apple replaced Samba with their own SMB implementation which does not support older SMB clients.A Samba-based SMB server for Lion is available that allowed me to record to a Lion Mac (though NOT to a Lion Server).  Google SMBup, and it's the first hit.  This is very easy to install (it's a self-contained app like any other mac app, and allows to install and remove the Samba-based SMB services).

Reviews.Title: Sharx 2606 is a Great Camera with Outstanding Cust. Service
Reviews.Author: Jeb
Reviews.Content: Update 6/20/2013-  Just purchased a second Sharx 2606.  The last time while setting up the first camera I didn't follow the manual's instructions; this time I found out how easy the installation is when you do.  Adding the second camera and using DNS hosting for this camera was a snap...the detailed instructions are included in the manual.  Both cameras are working flawlessly.  The 3rd party app I wanted to use with my iphone to view the camera wasn't working so the Sharx customer service folks sent me step by step setup instructions and got it working.  You will not find much better customer service than these guys.Update-3/6/2013- Just wanted to update my original review since I bought this camera and have used it constantly for 1 year. The Sharx 2606 still works flawlessly...no problems at all.  I use it to stream to WeatherUnderground and has been doing so for a year.  Over that year I did have to reboot it one time because the pictures stopped streaming, but that was it.  I can pull the video up from anywhere. This is a great product with super support.I read through all of the seller feedback on this camera.  From what I read I saw that the setup may be a challenge ( no network geek here) but the manual and customer service would make up for any problems that I may have, so I ordered the camera.It arrived on time and included was a very comprehensive manual. What struck me, and something I have NEVER seen on any other mail order merchandise is this sentence, highlighted in yellow on the manual: "We pledge that we will not let you fail. Contact us with any questions, no matter how simple or how complicated."So I started the setup. I have a MAC and an Airport Extreme wireless router, but it is connected to a Siemens modem/router (that generates the IP addresses). This combo kind of threw all the scenarios in the manual out the window. I plugged the camera into the ethernet and my Airport. The problem was that I disconnected it too early. Need to keep it plugged in until you can get the network username/password entered. After awhile of not getting a wireless connection, I plugged it back in. After 20 minutes of no connection I emailed Sharx.  This was about 10:30 PM.  Within 15 minutes I had a 2 page detailed email on my modem/router setup and what I needed to do.  I left it plugged in and went to bed.The next morning, the camera power indicator was blinking telling me it was connected and waiting on me, so I finished setting up what I should have finished the night before by following their instructions from the email.  The camera came on line, I disconnected the ethernet and placed it where I wanted in the house.I asked them a couple more questions about setting up to send to an FTP server and they sent me a detailed step-by-step procedure within 10 minutes.The camera picture is very sharp and has a lot of features that unfortunately I can't use in the setup that I have it in now (weathercam).  The wi-fi range is about 25 feet to the nearest router and have had no problems with it's signal quality.It would be great if other companies shared Sharx's passion of providing a great product, good documentation and outstanding customer service.

Reviews.Title: A Great First Impression -Updated
Reviews.Author: Elliott Light
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased this camera, I contacted customer service for Sharx.  This was on a Saturday.  They don't have a phone number.  You start a conversation with them via email.  I asked a lot of questions because I'd had an unpleasant experience with another brand and was returning it.  I received several replies and asked several more questions.  All of the emails were polite, understandable and informative.  The representative even suggested that I didn't need to buy the more expensive 2607 model!  Very cool.  So, I bought the 2606.If I hadn't confused myself, the whole configuration would have taken less than 30 minutes.  (An email to customer service generated a response in 5 minutes that identified my error.)I could actually see an image about ten minutes after opening the box.  The image is really impressive.  To gain web access, you must "fiddle" a bit, but the instructions are clear enough that I believe most folks can follow them without any problems.I will not repeat the details of the other reviewers.  Time will tell how the camera holds up.  But my first impressions, the company and the product deserve 5 stars.UPDATE:January 30, 2011 -After 2 months of remote usage, I'm still giving this product 5 stars.  I am also very impressed with the assistance I have received from customer support.UPDATE:December 4, 2011I bought two more of these cameras.  My experience with the first installation (at my home) was a five minute exercise that was straight out of the documentation.The second installation was somewhat challenging.  I installed this camera at a business office.  After fussing with an old 2 wire dsl modem/router, I was a bit discourage.  However, Sharx support is responsive, knowledgable and patient.  I was given instructions on how to configure the router.  However, at the end of the day, the dsl modem was replaced and the camera installation was easily completed.I've read the "nightmare" installation comments.  Given my experience with camera 2, I would guess that some of the nightmares are caused by the networking equipment and not the camera.  A network that uses a router than is configured to use uPNP should be a relative easy installation.  A router than doesn't support uPNP or says it does but doesn't requires the user to become more familiar with the router than he or she might want.  Sharx support knows this stuff and can help translate it for the network newbee.Based on my experience, this is a product that I believe offers a great bang for the buck and that is supported by people that want their customers to be happy.elight50

Reviews.Title: Easy to use for Non-Network Savy
Reviews.Author: ajl1970 "ajl1970"
Reviews.Content: This product is fantastic.  It is packed with a lot of great features.  Even though there are a lot of advanced features, as long as you have the most basic knowledge about your network, you will have no problem setting this thing up and running in  no time at all.  I was totally amazed at the amount of detail in the manual.  It is written in English (not dumb pictures that make no sense) and is full of detail.  It talks about iPhone Apps you can use and third party websites to register your home IP Address automatically so you can always access the camera from outside your house.  Everything you could want to do with this camera is discussed in great detail in the manual, I cannot tell you how impressed I was in this day and age of weak user guides that are just basic pictures and that is supposed to tell you how some advanced piece of networking gear is supposed to work.  Great job Sharx, you earned my future business.  Oh, and the email support was prompt and full of detailed information and that was on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: Finally, a high-quality easy to use webcam
Reviews.Author: R. Magnuson
Reviews.Content: I have purchased webcams (Linksys, Panasonic) over the years trying to find one that I can set up, works well and provides remote access over the Internet.  The Sharx 2606 is the first one that really works for me.  It has very fine image quality and is easy to set up.  It took about twenty minutes to set up the camera for local network access and remote Internet access including iPhone access.The weakest part of the product is its manual and lack of on-line support tools (such as FAQ's) but that is made up for by responsive technical support.  I had a question about setting up port forwarding in my router to allow for remote access of the webcam.  I sent an email to Sharx and received a phone call within minutes.  The issue was resolved in about five minutes during the call.I highly recommend the 2606 webcam and plan to purchase two more Sharx webcams.

Reviews.Title: This Camera is Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Lathe Haynes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a camera for a weekend house.  The camera works flawlessly and has many more features than I had expected.  After set up on the wireless mode, the camera can be put anywhere in the house and routes through my Apple Extreme router.  The instructions for setting it up with an Apple Extreme are step-by-step and flawless (there are also instructions Windows and other routers).  When I needed assistance, the email customer support was quick and informative.  When I needed more detailed help, I got phone help from one of the Sharx team who was very helpful and got the diagnosed the problem (my mistake) in a matter of minutes and then spent the time to tell me more of the features I would probably want to use.  Overall, it probably took me less than an hour to set up the camera and begin to get familiar with it.  Since then I've played around with other features and am discovering more of it's capabilities.  Besides the wireless mode, another feature that I've tried is remote viewing from anywhere there is the internet (hence almost everywhere in the world).  I also bought a Micro-SD card (highly recommended) for the camera (14.99 for 4GB) and like the ability of the camera to record pics onto the card either motion activated (loads of choices there also) or at regular intervals.  These pics can also be remotely viewed.  I also like the email feature that emails pics (again in my case motion activated) to an email account, again with loads of choices regarding how many, how many frames per second, etc. so as to not get thousands of pics on your email (I set up a gmail account specifically for this purpose; Sharx gives specific directions for setting it up in gmail so it will work, and it did the first time.  So far these are the features that I've set up; and another awesome thing is you can use these features simultaneously, e.g., have it record on the micro-SD card and email, etc.  The user guide has great directions for setting up this camera, including suggestions about what you might want to do when just starting out and what is more advanced, and as I said before, the email support was fast and great, and the telephone support was top notch (even though I only needed to use it once).  This camera exceeds my expectations, so much so that I'm going to get another for the outside of the property and maybe even another (the night vision one) for inside; after the initial setup adding cameras seems even easier.  BTW, the picture is sharp and clear, and you can use this camera as a digital video recorder (DVR) with the micro chip!  All the materials, style, documentation and workmanship demonstrate that a lot of thought has been put into this camera, its functions and the users.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted in an IP camera
Reviews.Author: M. Aepli
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that I could use as a baby monitor for when I am home and away. This was the best reviewed and priced camera that included everything I wanted, including audio.Set up was a little time consuming, but it was simple as could be. The picture is much clearer than I had expected. Our existing video monitor can't even compare when it comes to picture clarity. I wish the microphone were a little more sensitive, but that's my only complaint, and it's a minimal one.Now that everything is set up up, my husband and I can now watch and listen whenever and from wherever we want from our phones. Knowing we have this brings us both great peace of mind that we can check in when we're out and there's a babysitter here.

Reviews.Title: Finally, Netcams That Deliver
Reviews.Author: vRodder
Reviews.Content: I have tried a number of IP based network cameras such as the Axis M-1011, Toshiba IK-WD01A, etc., and this one has made it to the top of my list.It has the sharpest picture by far of any value-priced network camera I have tried.  Even though this is not the version with IR illumination, it still does very good in low light conditions.The product manual is very good, explaining ALL of the steps required to get the camera properly set up on your network.When I had a few questions about e-mailing on motion events, the company responded within an hour and explained exactly how to get things set up in my somewhat unusual case.I have also purchased the outdoor version which also works great and is an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: good camera, excellent customer service
Reviews.Author: Sean Kay "Sean"
Reviews.Content: At first when I received my camera, I had a bit of trouble setting it up.  I was frustrated to find that there was no contact number for customer service, instead you had to email them. So we emailed back and forth a few times until I asked to be called, and within 30 minutes, someone called and walked me through the setup.  Since then, I had a few more questions, and while its frustrating to email instead of call, they replied back within minutes every time.  I am blown away by how responsive and helpful their customer service is.One thing which I did not see in the description is that when moonlight mode is on, the frames per second drop from 30 to 7.5We use the camera as a monitor for our baby, and it works great, but at night, the adjacent bathroom light must be on with the door partially cracked to allow enough light for moonlight mode to work (a nightlight won't be enough).We will likely switch to the higher model for the infrared nightvision.  Overall though, it is a great camera and again, I cannot praise the customer service enough. Would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Super product
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: I've been using the Sharx SCNC2606 for about a month now. I works just as advertised with fantastic video quality and a lot of helpful user controls in the web based Settings panels. I first turned the camera on in a semi dark room and instantly the camera image was better than what I was seeing in the subdued light. The colors were very true and the image bright. I actually turned on the room light to verify how the room really appeared. And, this was all without the Moonlight mode on!I next positioned the camera facing to the outside through a window. Again, the colors (fall colors, in this case) were superb. I had good resolution of the street sign about 70 feet away. The leaves were falling from a nearby tree and I could follow each individual, multi-colored leaf falling to the ground. As the sun set and the neighborhood darkened, I could see people waking by the house about 40 feet away with minimal illumination from the 2 outside lights on the the house -- again, without the moonlight mode on.In summary, this is a great product and I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Very Capable Camera...
Reviews.Author: JME "Magohnem"
Reviews.Content: I have been playing around with WiFi camera for sometime now and the Sharx is one of the best I have tried.Goods====Excellent tech supportVery nice imageEasy setup if your familiar with your routerCompact and sturdyVery configurbleBads====Just"OK" wireless rangeMy average FPS = 10 over WifiI have used Dlink, Trendnet and Linksys Wifi cameras, and this camera is way above them in quality of picture/features. Though it does cost 2x as much. You really need to experience a bad WiFi camera (Dlink) to understand how good this camera is.I like it!I think the only way to get the 30 FPS would be to have the camera wired.I'm knocking a star off just for the WiFi range - I sill recommend the camera though.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product!  Up and running in 5 minutes.
Reviews.Author: Ordinary Guy "Dan"
Reviews.Content: After some research, I bought the Sharx based on the reviews from Mac users.This camera is nearly perfect for me.  I had it up and running on my wireless network in minutes.  Indoor and outdoor image is excellent.  Motion detection works great.  Configurable settings are numerous with lots of options to fit your environment.Only one minor nit for Mac users; you must use a Windows-based system with ActiveX to set the motion alarm area on the screen.  For most people, this should not be an issue.I've contacted Sharx support with questions via email a couple of times now and have had responses within 15 minutes!  Very responsive customer service.If you're in the market for one, do not hesitate buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: CMO
Reviews.Content: I have never been one to review products in the past but this product is so outstanding that I felt I must.The competition:Before I purchased the Sharx camera I tried 2 other cameras from Cisco and TrendNet but could not get either of them to work properly. Setting up a network camera for remote viewing requires considerable technical understanding. Both of these cameras came with worthless manuals and even worse tech support. (I would consider myself rather competent with computers)Sharx!I had this camera up and running within about an hour. The instructions are excellent and they cover everything in great detail.Customer service -((AMAZING)) -The day after I set up my camera it stopped working due to an issue with my router. Did Sharx tell me to call dlink like the other useless companies - NO. I sent them an email Friday afternoon asking for help. We carried on a conversation via email and the problem was fixed in no time. The longest I waited for a reply was maybe 30 mins at the most.Excellent product, even better service. Don't waste your time with other brands - they are cheaper but by the time you get them to actually work (if at all) you will wish you bought this camera that works perfect right out of the box.Negatives:NONE

Reviews.Title: Great features, easy setup, reliable operation
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: Superb little camera. Supports common encryptions, uPnP, DDNS, and PPPoe. It even syncs its timestamp clock to a NIST server!My favorite part is the alarming functionality. Movement of a configurable amount, independantly set in up to four quadrants, triggers an alarm. The alarm can capture a video clip to a file through Internet Explorer, FTP still shots to a server, email still shots, and even what looks like an HTTP post (though I haven't played with that yet). I haven't explored all the features, but everything I've used has worked perfectly. And this is ALL without any external capture software!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: N. Grammer "Nancy G."
Reviews.Content: I own two of these (same model) cameras and am very pleased with my purchases.  Set-up was very easy and I had no problems connecting to the wireless network.  My power has gone out numerous times but the camera boots up and reconnects to the router without problems.  The picture and sound are awesome and my cameras still perform flawlessly 3 years later.  I've purchased other cameras (different models) from this company and they perform just as well.Technical support is excellent in their knowledge and helpfulness.  Although there is no phone number to call (don't worry), you submit a request via their website and someone will respond to you within the day or the next day depending on the time of day you sent the request.  In some cases they will call you.  I also own another security system from a different company and their tech support will call you in two to three days.In summary, these are high quality cameras, reliable and reasonably priced.  In my opinion, the cameras are well worth the purchase and with any product that you buy, you've got to have top notch service from the company with whatever help you need.  I feel Sharx Security is one of those companies and that is why I've made multiple purchases of their products without regrets.

Reviews.Title: Solid product, great manual, and unequalled support
Reviews.Author: WJV
Reviews.Content: I set up the camera from a Mac (OSX Lion) and the manual led me along step by step to a successful, in the end  wireless, installation. The manual has an index! It is written logically and in comprehensible, grammatically correct English! The camera works great, even supports 802.11 n networking; I expected that because I have another similar model from the same manufacturer that has worked at a remote location for over a year. This time I contacted technical support because I had some questions. The response was on-topic, individualized, and comprehensive! I couldn't be more pleased. I don't usually write reviews, but I had to get this off my chest.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: ER
Reviews.Content: I bought Sharx SCNC2606, and Sharx SCNC2607, and SCNC2607W over six months ago. This review is for all of them. The cameras work as advertised and I can describe them all as AMAZING products. I'm not a tech savvy, but I followed the well written manual until I got them all working without a hitch, utilizing almost every single feature including saving to a NAS drive. Their incredible customer service is a different story. I had issues at first saving to my NAS drive, because of the way I set up my NAS, not because of the cameras, but Sharx customer service walked me through the NAS set up and the problems were solved. Never told me contact the NAS drive manufacturer. You can sense how well driven they are to make the Sharx products successful.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Colatown "IMHO"
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these wifi cameras as a "pet cam" and was so impressed, I bought a second one. The installation is not the easiest nor the most difficult - I guess it depends on your level of tech expertise, and I am middle of the road to better than average. They're not exactly "plug and play" but the good news is that they have EXCELLENT customer support. You email them a question and they answer you almost immediately. For me, that was twice, including after hours and on a weekend. The features are great! You can set it up to email you alerts; you can insert a memory card to have it record snapshots at intervals or when motion is detected; you can save data to a network drive; you can go online and check the live feed. It gave us peace of mind on a recent trip out of the country to be able to check on our house and pets. Really, I have been telling everyone about it. Very cool product.

Reviews.Title: Excellend product and awesome customer service
Reviews.Author: Rajinder Singh
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a IP Network camera that I can use to see my family when I was traveling. I did not want to use a Laptop with a webcam as that was too much hassle to setup.I came across Sharx SCNC 2606 at amazon and it got good reviews. Even before buying the camera I had questions for the camera manufacturer. I was concerned about the wireless range.These quesitons were answered on the same day.The camera was not cheap but I took a chance and ordered it.I work in IT and I have a complex home network so it was easy for me to setup the camera.Picture quality is decent. The manual is impressive. They have done a good job in explaining everything.This camera was able to use UPNP service on my router to setup the external access automatically.I also tried setting up the camera with manual port forwarding and it worked fine.I have the latest firware version 4.20 installed on it. This version does not require MicroSD card to record on a computer or a nas device.It does not have a 2-way audio feature that their outdoor cameras do.I was able to view the live stream using IPhone but had trouble in seeing it on my Windows Mobile 6.5 phone.I emailed them this morning and in a few hours I got a detailed response.Sharx seems to be small company. They don't give out their support phone number. They don't have an automtic or even manaul way to update the firmware. Their support team will do the upgrade for you. However their support is very prompt in replying to emails. A lot of big companies can learn a lot from their customer service. I hope Sharx stays in business for a while as I am about to buy my 2nd camera from them.

Reviews.Title: simpy outstanding
Reviews.Author: Keith L. Klein MD "takasden"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased about a half a dozen IP video cameras over the years and everyone has been a stuggle to set up, and once disconnected from the computer, none have functioned very well wirelessly, and in fact most don't even work.So I was quite surprised how incredibly easy this was to set up in every way.  The manual is easy to understand, very thorough, written in a friendly style and covers every situation.  Everything went exactly as it should through each step of the installation process.  The camera itself feels solidly built, with an outstanding video picture.  It is far ahead of the pack if IP video cameras.  I am so impressed, I have ordered a second one for another installation.I think many manufacturers have to look at the quality of the build and the way the manual is written as an example of an outstanding product.  Regarding their technical support, I cannot comment as the manual is so well written and comprehensive, that I did not need to contact them.

Reviews.Title: Set up can be difficult depending on you router model
Reviews.Author: Mr. Electric
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that set up is difficult for all wireless ip cams so this is not an issue localized to this camera alone. I had a great deal of difficulty completing set up until I bought  a new router. Once I switched to the Netgear WGR614 V10 setup was a breeze. Save yourself some trouble and make sure you have a wireless router that will connect using UPNP (Universal Plug N Play) otherwise you will have to learn every minute detail of network set up and terminology in the process of getting your camera working. I would guess that any router purchased in the last year or two would work well. Sharx recommends the Netgear WGR614 v9 or v10 which is only $35.Once set up the camera is very nice. I use it with the icam app and look at my front gate from my ipad easily and reliably as well as record motion events.  Moonlight mode works well, construction seems to be a cut above the normal made in china electronic equipment I am accustomed to. Customer support was also excellent, my emails got replies within a short period of time.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for home wireless use
Reviews.Author: Luis G. Martinez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this camera to use initially as a nanny cam and then simply as a way to look and listen in on our son now that we are both back to work and miss him terribly.  So far the camera has been great.  It offers a very clear picture and really excellent sound.  We are able to hear what's happening around the whole apartment.  The manual made setting up the camera as simple as it can be which is still a bit complicated.  But if you follow the step by step process you should not have a problem.  Now we can both look in through our smartphones and have our very own website with a live stream of our apartment.  Can't ask for much else.  We can also record to the computer or record to a memory card but we don't use that feature much.  All in all with are VERY satisfied with this purchase.  Look into all the amazon vendors (including Sharx Security themselves) for the best price.

Reviews.Title: So far so GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Faja4x
Reviews.Content: Very nice.  Installation was a breeze. I am techie though, so I knew what to expect.  This thing works great.  I especially love being able to view on the Touch Pro 2 phones.  Great piece of security equipment.Update: 12/31/10:  This thing continues to impress...runs like a champ.  On very very seldom occasions the frames per second slow down, but a simple reboot straightens that out and you can do that remotely!We use it in our receptionistless reception area to monitor traffic.  Just super.

Reviews.Title: Great web cam, parents/grandparents can see my daughter!
Reviews.Author: The World's Greatest
Reviews.Content: Yes, I know a cheapo wired web cam can show them my daughter as well, but I dont want to have to put her in front on my computer every time I want to show her to them. With this wireless cam I can show her in more natural positons like in her crib, on my bed, in the swing, downstairs, chaning the diaper in the bathroom, outside the house, or just me or my wife holding her in the living room.This web cam is not as east to set up as the wired versions, this required a little knowledge of networking, but the unusual manual and helps you with this, and they have a help center which others have said it very good, luckily I didn't need it myself.If all you need is a basic web cam, then this is not for you. This is great for showing off the kids to relative who live too far away to come often.Price is high in my opinion, but what am I gonna do? make one myself? Showing my mother her first grandchild is pricless, so its worth the cost to me. The other sharx2607 has infared, but its daytime colors are not as good, good luck with your decision. Merry Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Setup was much easier than expected!
Reviews.Author: SnoGirl
Reviews.Content: I don't consider myself a techie, although my husband is happy that I am capable of hooking up and configuring all of our electronics. :)  With that said, based on previous reviews, I was a bit concerned that I would be in over my head setting up this camera.  However, setup was an absolute breeze.  I had my camera working wireless in less than 20 minutes.  The setup of remote access took a bit more attention but it was not difficult.  Plus, I used the recommended free [...] site to create my own hostname and point it towards my dynamic IP.  As others have already stated, the image quality is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great Security camera and Great Support
Reviews.Author: J. Rafuse "On the Fly"
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a home computer based camera that I could use for security. This is it! My system is Mac based, but I'm sure it works just as good with PC's, and the recording functions are enabled for PC's right out of the box.Set up was straightforward, but not mindless. You have to know your way around computers a bit to "train" the camera to your WIFI network, but once done, you can disconnect the ethernet cable and voila! I have unplugged the camera and replugged it back in around the house, sometimes with two weeks downtime in between, and it's still right there on my computer screen.The camera works just as advertised, you can see it from a local network, or from the internet at large using the IP address with no special FTP software, sites or anything else. It just works! Worked just as well from my wife's iTouch (would be the same on an iPhone), again, with no hassles.Picture quality outshines any smaller USB iChat type cameras, and it can "hear" sounds as well. You have to use Quicktime to hear sounds on the Mac systems, but we all have it, so not a problem.I have not tried recording images from the camera, nor the motion activation to record function (third party info included for Macs; built in for PC's), but I use it primarily for live checking on a property 1500 miles away.Works anywhere in the house you place it, as long as it can access the WIFI signal.To top if off, the support group was prompt, informative and comprehensive in replying to queries, but this support is only available by email, no phone support that I could find. Who needs it with that kind of email support though? When I ordered two more cameras, they upgraded my shipping at no cost.Great camera, great deal, good people to back it up.

Reviews.Title: Camera works
Reviews.Author: Larry Valtelhas
Reviews.Content: Excellent pre-sales technical support using email. The camera does take time to set up, mostly to get the password codes correct for wifi use. I set it up with an old Mac-mini and OS 10.4. The image is as expected and is being used to monitor the taking of medication (pills). At the time of this writing, I have used it for three weeks. Since that time, my wifi (Airport Extreme) had to be rebooted twice due to thunderstorm power outages, but the camera didn't need any extra care. I think if I disconnect the computer from the wifi, the Airport will not have to be rebooted either. The image has couple of second delay, but comes in very well over the internet when using a computer. The image is clear, but choppy using my iPod touch. I think I can make the image smaller and get rid of that. I only had one technical problem with internet access, which technical support solved, again using email. I recommend the product primarily for the customer service I received. The company makes some other cameras that I would like to use, but Macs are not supported.

Reviews.Title: AN INSTALLATION NIGHTMARE !
Reviews.Author: trgo
Reviews.Content: The SHARX 2606 has very good picture quality, but it is a miserable process to get the camera set up for wireless use.If I had fully realized the setup issues, I probably would have not purchased the camera!The greatest single problem, is that SHARX technical advice is ONLY available via e-mail.When you e-mail a question, sometimes it is answered very promptly, but it can take an hour or more for an answer. Multiply that by 3 or four questions, and at least half a day is already gone, with the camera likely still not completely setup. What then? STILL MORE e-mails !!Perhaps if you are a computer geek, the setup may be easier for you.For ordinary people, the SHARX 2606 setup is a total nightmare!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: MN Techie
Reviews.Content: I ended up purchasing this directly through the vendor to save a step of updating the firmware as soon as I received it. I contacted their customer service before my decision to purchase to clarify some questions - they were extremely quick in their response and very knowledgeable too. They told me that if purchased from their website, the cameras would ship with the latest firmware. He also explained the new features that have been added with the new firmware (periodically transferring files from the sd card to an ftp server and clearing out the card for further recording was a key one).Why I purchased this camera - I did a lot of web research and narrowed it to this camera and a panasonic. I purchased the panosonic camera first since it had PTZ -unfortunately, I could only record on my PC with that camera's software - and when the recording was active, my PC would slow to a crawl (a fairly new PC with a quad core processor and plenty of RAM). Even viewing the camera using the software would slow down my PC (access through browser was okay).Therefore, I wanted a camera that could record directly to a microSD card to avoid having a PC tied up for recording. It does have a microphone and can do motion sensing - the description in Amazon does not provide in-depth details - talking to Sharx customer service before purchaing was very useful in this regard. I wish it had PTZ also but that was not a deal breaker for me - I was able to place the camera on top of a shelf to get a wide view of my room.This camera meets all my requirements - fantastic picture quality, very easy to setup, records to a microSD card. I am fairly tech savvy and am somewhat familiar with router setup - so setting up access from the internet using port forwarding was not an issue. Nevertheless, the manual that comes with it is very detailed. I use ethernet over power to have a wired hookup for this camera - although I did test the wireless functionality and it was flawless.I have had the camera for a few weeks now-  I have motion sense recording done for a few hours every week. I get regular snapshots by email during the time slots I have setup for monitoring. Haven't had a single issue to date. Unless you absolutely need PTZ I would recommend this camera over the panasonic. Overall, a great camera.

Reviews.Title: extremely simple to setup using windows / mac
Reviews.Author: MB "MB"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on a little research and am using it primarily with a MAC and some software for home security.  The camera was very simple to setup and I have to say, the instructions that came with it, have to be some of the best instructions and simple to follow that I've ever seen.  I setup the camera using an attached ethernet cable first, but I use it completely wireless now.  I've learned over the years, some of these standalone wireless devices are just easier to setup with an attached connection first then trying to setup wireless from the get go.now, why 4 stars and not 5.  Well, in G mode it is a little grainy and people walking in front of the camera I have to wonder how clear a shot I would get of someone's face, I have it too far away to really get that, but  I wanted to cover a large area of the house.  Also, this camera needs light.  There is no good shot with the lights off at night, might as well be looking at a black room, I was surprised visibility was this poor, but I think all these cameras will only be able to do that much.  If you really want night vision, you have to get the infrared version.

Reviews.Title: Warning: Does not record at full resolution
Reviews.Author: Ross Capdeville "jiadar"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few weeks and was constantly tinkering with the settings to get decent quality recording. I have a 1 Gbit wired network, with a file server that has more than adequate disk I/O. I set the camera to record a stream at 1024k bit rate, 30 fps, and quality 60. The recorded video would "freeze" every few seconds. I also tried recording to an SD card, with even worse results. Note that the settings I am using are half of the maximum supported settings (2048k bit rate) and still the quality leaves something to be desired.I emailed the vendor, who gave a quick response, and said that in order to record I should use 15 fps, otherwise the camera CPU could not keep up. The vendor stated something to the effect that "it's a computer, and it can only do so much". Additionally, when recording, the camera should not be doing any other functions (image capture, viewing, etc).I feel it is misleading to advertize a camera that is 30 fps, when in fact, it is impossible to capture video at that frame rate from the camera. I would have certainly paid a little more for a processor able to keep up with 30 fps.Still, the camera deserves some praise. The functionality/features implemented exceeds the other security cameras I have (in the $100 range), and is implemented well. Integrated dynamic DNS, FTP, email, and NAS support are all appreciated. The scheduling functionality is also a great feature.

Reviews.Title: Just a relabeled y-cam
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This product is nothing but a rebadged Y-cam.  That in itself is not necessarily bad but it is a bit overpriced for your money.  Panasonic makes tilt/swivel models that are just as good at night vision and have far superior features.  I don't find the low light capabilities outstanding even in the moonlight mode.  In fact, moonlight mode is basically useless because when you turn it on, everything taken during the day is burned out and the image is horrible.  Not sure why they can't make the moonlight mode automatic when you turn it on so that it only slips into moonlight mode when it gets dark enough (without it affecting daylight mode).  Also, the view from this camera is very wide angle: too wide.  Sure, you can cover a lot of ground but with only 640 x 480 resolution, even people walking 50 feet from the camera are extremely small and not well defined.  Good luck trying to ID someone if this is going to be a security camera installation.  The unit works and was easy to set up, but my conclusion is you don't get much for your (lot of) money.UPDATE: I've basically written off Sharx cameras as viable surveillance cameras.  I recently got an Axis M1011-W to replace this Sharx unit because the Sharx unit recorded nothing but a blur in broad daylight when recording cars passing by on a private road at low speed.  The Sharx allows no control over exposure or shutter speed while the Axis camera is so loaded with features that you can select the actual shutter speed and gain (in dB) for your application, set different motion boxes/sensitivities for different parts of the day, etc.  The Axis camera is more difficult to set up due to the plethora of features but if you need flexibility and even better low light performance, get the Axis M1011-W instead of this Sharx.  The Axis is as good or better as far as picture quality and it has enough control to allow you to set it up properly for security applications.

Reviews.Title: I am very happy...
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with an network camera (SCNC2606) and I must say that I am very pleased with how it works.  Typically with products like this I usually end up thinking this isn't quite working right and then I start looking for a way around the products short comings. With this camera it has not happened... other than a few very minor issues.I've had the camera up and running for a couple days and it's performed exactly as I had hoped it would.  I have it setup to upload photos to a FTP/Website every thirty minutes or when the motion detection is triggered.  One of the things I really like about the FTP upload is that you can specify different file names and upload directories for the timed images vs those taken when there is motion.  This function has worked perfectly for me.I also have the camera setup to email me when there is motion.  It allows you to send to three different email addresses, include the image or not and set one of three resolutions for the images.  I use gmail for an SMTP server.  The gmail website explains how to configure the SMTP settings and lists two port numbers.  One port number worked the other did not.I also installed a SD card to save the images locally.  Again, I am saving stills at 30 minute increments and capturing 30 seconds of video with motion detection.  The video isn't exactly smooth but it's enough to do the job.When I was testing this on my home network I was able to get it to allocate an IP address so I could remotely access the camera from the internet.  It's nice that you can view the camera and also setup the camera using the remote connection.  However, when I set it up on my other network it didn't work correcly.  The other network is running through an Encore ENHWI-3GN3 router that is hooked up to the internet via a truconnect.com USB760 3G modem.  I suspect the problem is with this equipment and not the camera itself since i did have it working on a more traditional network.I have used it both wired and secure wireless modes without any problems.  I have not tested the wifi range of the camera yet.The software interface is simple and easy to understand.  I only had to look at the manual to understand the terminology used to describe the time duration of the capture and the number of images captured.The minor issues... it would be great to have a button in the software that would test the FTP and email functions.  Yes, the camera can be set to send a image every five seconds or so to make it happen but it would be nice to to this with a button click.  I would also be good to get some feedback as to if the FTP and email connections were working correctly.  Something like a "test the settings" button.The only other thing that would be really cool to have with this is some kind of verification that the email or FTP upload worked correctly.  Using a 3G modem with medium strength causes file transfer errors occasionally.  If the camera could be setup to verify the ftp transfer and email sending that would be awesome.Anyhow... a bit long-winded here but I am very happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Best video quality I have seen!
Reviews.Author: N. Manoochehri
Reviews.Content: Excellent Day Time colors! Purchased this camera along with the 2607 because the day time colors on this one are better. Both cameras have great video quality, even on my iPhone!

Reviews.Title: I've had this unit for 3-4 years ... works FANTASTIC
Reviews.Author: mini_hakr "mini_hakr"
Reviews.Content: Rather than rehash the other reviews, I rigged my 2606 up on my porch, and ran a Cat5e cable to it. I also ordered from Amazon "AIR802 POEPASS-01 Passive PoE Injector/Splitter with 5.5 mm x 2.1 mm DC Size Connector" as a power-injector over Ethernet (which splits off the power to a separate cable you plug into the back of the unit).Compared to the Foscam I also have, the Sharx 2606 @ $149 is a great deal (I bought it when it was $300). Better resolution/lens. Better low-light response.

Reviews.Title: Works very well
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Like all windows networking stuff, its fiddly to get going, especially if your router doesn't let you (or you can't figure out how to) lock the IP address for the camera. I'm not using their software on my pc, just a browser. I'm also using it over wi-fi, not ethernet. My router assigns a new IP for each power failure (I have a double handfull of stuff on the network) and then I use Norton to figure out what the new one is. Other than that it works fine, though I'll admit I haven't tried any of the alarm settings and I'm not using the audio because the camera is viewing thru a window and only supplies the indoor sound anyway. I'm also not trying to view it from outside my home network.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: JPV "JPV"
Reviews.Content: Works great. But I needed a little help to get it set up so I could view over the internet when I was away from home. I called the Sharx tech support number and within 15 minutes tech #18 called me and helped me rectify the trouble.  Very nice camera, able to put it anywhere in the house I want to. Very nice. Easy to set up or if you need help, they are only a email message and phone call away. They respond quickly and are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled with Purchase
Reviews.Author: ymbvpoy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera last week to look in on my cats while leaving them alone for the weekend for the first time.  Having read several reviews of these types of products, I settled on this one for its rich feature set (even though it was one of the more costly models). Wifi was very important.  When I got it home, the basic setup was very simple and easy to implement.  I have not yet used some of the more advanced feature sets like FTP or email alerts, but the basic camera - streaming video implementation works perfectly.  The only trouble I had was verifying that the feed was working with my router's external IP address, but then I realized I simply needed to disconnect my iPhone from my Wifi to resolve the external IP.I am very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking implement a pet cam or baby cam.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Rick Bruner
Reviews.Content: I can say this camara is amazing. It does everything I want it to. I have Fios, took 20 minutes to set up. The directions worked perfect. AT&T; blackberry works great. very little lag time if any.

Reviews.Title: Great for watching little ones
Reviews.Author: Mamaschmidt83
Reviews.Content: This camera has been great at keeping an eye on my little one while he takes a nap during the day. I also find it extremely helpful when I'm in the other room doing laundry, dishes, etc. and I can look at my laptop and see him playing with his toys. It just makes it easier to take care of him and get things done during the day. The live stream is fast, audio sounds great, and the video quality is fantastic as well. I really can't see enough great things about this camera.

Reviews.Title: PEACE OF MIND
Reviews.Author: JPPIII
Reviews.Content: I got this camera so I could check up on my house while I was out of the country for 10 days.  It did not disappoint!I was able to log in each day and see live video and also check the recordings on the microSD card to see if all was ok.This allowed me to have the peace of mind I needed to enjoy my trip.I showed the camera to some friends I met and they were amazed!  They kept asking me to check the camera so they could see it.I'll be adding a few more Sharx cameras before my next trip so I can have full video coverage for my house and yard.

Reviews.Title: GREAT SECURITY CAM!
Reviews.Author: J.J.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this cam after reading a lot of reviews and doing a lot of research.It took a while to get set up the way i wanted and will agree with some other people that this cam is difficult to set up at first but once i read the book a dozen times and did some more technical research on the internet i finally figured it out,the motion detection email works great too! i did have to get help through the sharx support team one time and i must say they were very responsive.All in all you can not go wrong with this cam, a lot of bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera and exemplary customer service from Sharx
Reviews.Author: wfl
Reviews.Content: I now own two of these cameras plus the relatively new SCNC3605.  The cameras are incredibly reliable and once you get comfortable with the firmware very versatile. The picture quality is good, even in low light and the ability to view from any 3G phone or web browser is fantastic - I travel internationally most of the year and really appreciate the fact that I can have a window back to home at any time.  The original manual was kind of hard to follow for the "uninitiated" but the customer service is exceptional.  Any query is not too difficult to answer and will typically be answered within the hour, sometimes minutes.  For the price, you also can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, excellent support...you want the best you found it
Reviews.Author: voodoo
Reviews.Content: UPDATE at end of original review:I have been looking for a nice wireless camera to monitor a room in our house, and I stumbled on this camera by accident.  Man am I glad I did; after reading a few of the Amazon reviews I placed my order, and received it quickly.  Setup wasn't cake, but I wouldn't say it was difficult either.  Because I was not familiar with the product or process it took me a while to go through all the settings, but that's because this camera is so feature-rich.Others have detailed the features and highlights of this camera, so I won't go into that detail.  I will say that the camera does what it should perfectly.  I love the fact that I can log into a website and see my camera feed in real-time; after setting it up, we left for the weekend to visit the parents.  I logged into the website to show them how it works and they were very impressed.I already have plans to add a couple of the SCNC2607 cameras for the infrared capabilities, and a couple more of the SCNC2606.  I do wish there was a pan/tilt/zoom feature; I know one of their models used to offer this, but can't seem to find it for sale.  Anyway, great camera with a great picture and super features...what else do you need?UPDATE 1/16/13: Still working perfectly.
